profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: Records include complete case files from three individual studies at Alameda High School in Alameda, CA, MR Trace Elementary School in San Jose, CA, and Jordan Junior High School in Palo Alto, CA; summary folders from all other cases; and general administrative files.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. Robert N. Bush, 1994.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Stanford Consultation Services Records (SC0481). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: The Stanford Consultation Services, under the direction of Education Professor Robert N. Bush, conducted case studies of teachers and administrators in selected school systems in California, Colorado, Washington, and Australia. Evaluation and rating forms were filled out by students and colleagues of the individual being studied.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: These records, dating from 1949 to 1956, were received as part of Robert N. Bush's papers but have been catalogued separately. Due to their large volume, the records were sampled in the following manner. Three separate cases representing different school ages were kept in their entirety: Alameda High School, Alameda, CA (case 60T); MR Trace Elementary School, San Jose, CA (case 79.2T); and Jordan Jr. High School, Palo Alto, CA (case 88T). Summary folders from all remaining cases were kept as well as all general administrative files.
General Allocation of Numbers to School Districts
Edison Elementary School (69.1 t, 69.2 t, 69.3 a)
Porter Elementary School (67 a, 68 t, 69 t, 69.4 t)
Jefferson Elementary School (70 t, 71 t, 72a, 79.1 t )
MR Trace Elementary School (73 a, 74 t, 75t, 79.2 t)
Herbert Hoover Jr. High (76 t, 77a, 78 t)
Palo Alto High School (87 t, 89 t, 89.lt)
Mayfield Elementary School (80 t, 81 t, 82 a, 83 t, 89.2 t)
Jordan Jr. High School (84 t, 85 t, 86 t, 88t)
Sydney Church of England Grammar School (91 t)

The cases shall be numbered according to center, each one followed by a small letter t, a, or s to indicate whether a teacher, administrator or supervisor. A band of 10 shall be used for each school system--when the 9th case is reached as in Alameda, e.g., the numbering will proceed as follows: 68,69,69.1,69.2 etc. Appropriate pseudonyms should be assigned as soon as possible. Always use number where names are asked for.
